comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: I think it's this Count Andrassy (Gyula the Younger, 1860-1929): en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gyula_Andr%C3%A1ssy_the_Younger He was in the news in 1915, urging peace in Europe and increasing democracy in Hungary.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
pennylrichardsca,

Despite the age difference between the two photos, I'm inclined to agree with your identification! Several key facial features seem like a match. Thanks for this info!

comment.author: 7525534@N02
comment._content: I just found this site, which is curated by the "Count Gyula Andrássy jr. Foundation". There you can find this very same image. (Unfortunately the site is only in Hungarian.) So it is the younger Andrássy. Additionally, there is an embossed stamp in the bottom right corner with the name of the studio and a date: 1906 - if I read it right. The name of the studio reads "Koller tanár utódai", which means "Successors of Teacher/Professor Koller". "Professor Koller" was a photographer in Budapest around 1890, his full name was Károly Koller. You can find other images on flickr with the same tag at the bottom, like this one. In fact, ggaabboo has a whole set dedicated to Koller and his successors.
